parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post may not be officially sanctioned campaign material.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Emanuel Cioaca, a candidate for the Senate, and the ADN party.  It clearly identifies a specific candidate participating in the parliamentary elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its potential reach, indicating an intention to address the public at large. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Emanuel Cioaca and the ADN party in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  Phrases like "Votam masiv" (Vote massively) and "Alaturati-va noua" (Join us) directly urge voters to vote for a specific candidate. This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It does not present objective information or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and party, lacking the neutrality expected in journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action promoting a specific candidate and party in the election. The language used is overtly promotional and persuasive, not simply expressing a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>531685073178199</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Federatia Romanilor de Pretutindeni, promotes Emanuel Cioaca (ADN) for the Senate elections.  The post's language ("Votam masiv," "Alaturati-va noua") directly encourages voters to support a specific candidate.  The post targets a wide audience through paid advertising on Facebook, and the hashtags further increase its reach.  The post's objective is clearly to influence the election outcome by increasing votes for Cioaca and ADN.  While it doesn't contain a CMF number, the other elements strongly suggest it's electoral propaganda.  The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Emanuel Cioaca</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>FRP</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Federatia Romanilor de Pretutindeni, pentru incalcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, dupa ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postari pe Facebook (ID 531685073178199) cu scopul de a influenta votul in favoarea candidatului Emanuel Cioaca (ADN) la alegerile parlamentare, folosind fraze precum "Votam masiv" si "Alaturati-va noua" intr-o campanie platita (RON300-RON399) care a atins 10.000-15.000 de impresii, cu o estimare a raspandirii de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane, avand in vedere ca perioada de campanie electorala s-a incheiat,  constituie propaganda electorala interzisa.  Contact: sedecoro@gmail.com, +40774533702, Strada Italia 4, Chiajna , Ilfov 077040, RO.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
